DOC.brief_summary: The purpose establish whether acupuncture addition conventional rehabilitation programme improve functional outcome quality life surgical patient haemorrhagic stroke , compare conventional rehabilitation programme alone .
DOC.brief_title: Can Acupuncture Benefit Surgical Patients With Haemorrhagic Stroke ?
DOC.detailed_description: The investigator aim recruit 60 patient 30 month period . Each patient six week acupuncture treatment ( either early within first six week , delay first six week observation assessment primary outcome ) . Primary outcome measure : Clinical outcome end week 6 acupuncture treatment : Glasgow Outcome Score extend . Secondary outcome measure : Modified Rankin Score , Functional Independence Measure ( FIM ) score , Modified Aschoff Score , Neurocognitive State Examination ( NCSE ) score , Barthel index , Modified Rivermead Mobility Index ( MRMI ) , Modified Functional Ambulation Category ( MFAC ) motor score upper limb lower limb Fugl-Meyer Scale end week six acupuncture treatment .
